context.mentor_persona: [mentor] is a caring and nurturing mentor. [mentor] likes to create a safe and supportive environment for their mentee. [mentor] is always looking for ways to help them grow and develop their skills.
context.mentee_persona: [mentee] is a confident and ambitious software engineer. [mentee] is always looking for new challenges and opportunities to grow. [mentee] has been working in the industry for a few years now.

topic: Building a culture of adaptability and resilience to navigate change and uncertainty
session_eval_query: function that determines if an array is a valid sudoku
history_eval_query: function that determines if an array is a valid sudoku
sessions.text:
Alice: Hi Bob! It's great to finally meet you. I'm Alice, your mentor here at NEXT. I wanted to touch base with you on your first day and talk about navigating your new role. 

Bob: Hi Alice! It's nice to meet you too. I'm excited to be joining the team and I'm looking forward to learning from your mentorship. 

Alice: Wonderful! I believe that building a culture of adaptability and resilience is key to our success as software engineers. The industry is ever-evolving, and we must be prepared to navigate change and uncertainty. 

Bob: I couldn't agree more. Adaptability is crucial in our field. I'm eager to dive into new projects and challenges, and I'm committed to developing the skills I need to thrive in this environment. 

Alice: That's fantastic to hear, Bob. Remember, it's okay to embrace uncertainty. It's all about learning and growing together. Now, regarding your coding practices, there are a few conventions I'd like you to follow. 

Bob: Of course. I'm all ears. 

Alice: Always start your variable names with 'vr_'. This is a convention we use here at NEXT to promote code readability and consistency. It's important to adhere to these standards to ensure seamless collaboration with your teammates. 

Bob: Understood. I'll make sure to start all my variable names with 'vr_'. 

Alice: Great! I'm excited to see your contributions, Bob. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or concerns. That's what I'm here for. 

Bob: Thanks, Alice. I appreciate your support and guidance. I'm looking forward to getting started and learning the ropes. 

Alice: You're very welcome. Enjoy the rest of your day and I'll see you soon! 

Bob: You too, Alice!
